meanings.definition: To put or place back into something
meanings.sent1: She carefully reinserted the key into the lock.
meanings.sent2: After fixing the broken piece, he reinserted it into the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful squirrel had to reinsert the acorn multiple times into the hole.
meanings.sent4: He reinserted himself into the conversation, adding his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic skillfully reinserted the engine part, making the car run smoothly again.

meanings.sent1: The librarian reinserted the misplaced book onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She reinserted the USB drive after transferring the files.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinserted the rabbit into the hat for another trick.
meanings.sent4: He reinserted the batteries into the remote control, hoping it would work.
meanings.sent5: The doctor reinserted the needle to continue the injection process.
